How does the Verus DeFi protocol address the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running in currency conversions?

The Verus DeFi protocol addresses the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running by ensuring that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. This provides a fair and transparent conversion process, eliminating the opportunities for MEV and front-running.

ncies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.
## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
- Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockchain, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.
## Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge)
- Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price neutral carve-out

What is the benefit of launching a new blockchain with a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool?

The benefit of launching a new blockchain with a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool is that all fees generated via cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain, with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain. This provides a seamless and self-sustaining ecosystem for the new blockchain.

How does Verus ensure that new blockchain and bridge launches are successful and meet minimum participation requirements?

Verus ensures that new blockchain and bridge launches are successful and meet minimum participation requirements by allowing users to set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in their preferred currencies on-chain. If the minimums are not met by the start time of the blockchain, all participants will automatically get a refund of all their pre-conversions, less the network fees. This provides a risk-free way to launch new blockchains and bridges.

What are some of the launch options available for blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches on Verus?

Some of the launch options available for blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches on Verus include setting minimum and maximum participation levels, offering pre-launch discounts, and making price-neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies. Additionally, there is also a price-neutral carve-out option available.
